summary:
I'm a high-performance IT Infrastructure Engineer with more than 6 years of proven experience participating in design, delivery and maintenance of small (<10 people, <10M subscribers,  <US$5M) and large-sized (>100 people, 30M subscribers, >US$20M) IT projects such as CBS, AAA, NGIN and EPC for different mobile ISPs (Digitel Corporation, Telefonica Movistar, Telecom Argentina) in Latin America Region.

I have strong expertise with Linux (RHEL, SUSE), virtualization (VMWare vCenter, ESXi), cloud computing (OpenStack, PaaS, IaaS, SaaS), storage technologies (iSCSI, FC, SAN), load balancing configuration (F5, SLB), high availability (HACS, DRP, clustering), Oracle DB administration, networking (IP addressing, VLSM, L3 protocols (OSPFv2, OSPF Multiarea, EIGRP, HSRP, RIPv2, protocol redistribution), L2 protocols (VLAN, STP, VTP, EtherChannel), NAT, ACL, Tunneling (IPsec, GRE)), identity and access management (LDAP integration, role configuration), Dev/QA/Production environment set up, administration, and software release implementation, traffic management by using DNS. 

During my professional experience, I have developed solid negotiation skills which have made me able to mitigate and solve technical concerns in a professional manner to reduce unnecessary workload whenever is possible.

I strongly believe in teamwork, collaboration, continuous improvement and the need for endless self-education is part of my DNA. Proactivity, perseverance, persistence, responsibility, respect, and commitment are some of my core values. I am characterized by always willing to learn from successes, failures and difficult situations.

profile_positions.description:
IT Infrastructure engineer of 4 different phases of Telecom Argentina Convergent Billing System Project such as: 
• Telecom Argentina CBS project Phase 1. (Prepaid delivery phase).
• Telecom Argentina CBS project Phase 1.5. (Quota Control for Postpaid subscribers (Sy)).
•	Telecom Argentina CBS project Phase 2. (Postpaid delivery phase). 
•	Telecom Argentina OCS Expansion (Hardware, application and Oracle DB expansion, internal balance migration after expansion).

Main responsibilities:
•	Infrastructure technical single point of contact.
•	Single point of contact during MOP discussions/implementations in Dev, QA, and Production environment.
•	Documenting password change procedures, integrations flows, common issues, among other technical documents.
•	Infrastructure weekly/monthly plan preparation accordingly with project master plan.
•	LLD Design.
•	Physical resources planning and allocation (Compute and Storage resources).
•	VM Creation for production environment using ITPaaS/OpenStack/Digital Foundry/VMWare.
•	FusionSphere OpenStack administration (glance, nova, cinder, neutron).
•	LUN creation and mapping to the compute nodes' physical servers for DB installation. 
•	CBS installation and software release installation in Dev/QA/Production env. 
•	Test environments (Dev/QA) set up from scratch, 3rd parties’ integration, incident support, and rectification. 
•	Load balancer configuration (SLB) for web server cluster.
•	GDR verification.
•	Southbound integration between CBS and Core Network Elements (PCRF, PGW, NGIN, SMSC).
•	Identity and access management configuration.
•	CBS modules integration with its Internal NMS, as well as Internal NMS integration with External NMS.
•	SSO configuration between CBS GUI and all external modules GUI.
•	Northbound integration based on SOAP.
•	LBI Report configuration for CBS Phase 2 (Postpaid subscribers).
•	Validate with L2 and L3 support complex technical requirements.
•	Scripting to automate repetitive and simple tasks.
profile_positions.title: IT Infrastructure Engineer (Technical Team Leader) | Consultant at Huawei Technologies Co. Ltd

profile_positions.description:
As IT Infrastructure Engineer for Carrier Software Department, I was part of the Operating & Maintenance Team for NGIN, AAA WiFi, AAA WCDMA of Telefonica Movistar. The main responsibilities were: 

•	Providing onsite technical support.
•	Service and platform monitoring.
•	Precautions and rectifications implementation. 
•	Attending and processing new requirements from different stakeholders from Telefonica Movistar. 
•	Technical point of contact during MOP implementation and service outages.
•	Trouble tickets handling, escalation and follow up on fault resolution process with respective teams. 

After worked for O&M team I joined the delivery team of AAA WCDMA Upgrade for Telefonica Movistar Venezuela. The main responsibilities were:

•	LLD design.
•	Physical resources planning and allocation (Compute, Storage, Networking resources).
•	Installation planning.
•	Hardware Installation (Chassis, blade servers, rack servers, Load Balancers, Core Switches, Firewalls).
•	Power on the devices.
•	Common software installation (OS, Patches, Initial OS Configuration, network interfaces configuration and bond configuration).
•	Configuring network devices (Switch boards, Core switches, Load Balancer (F5) and Firewalls (EUDEMON).
•	Network device integration with customer Service (Cisco Catalyst 4500) and Management networks (Cisco Catalyst 4500).
•	Installation and commissioning of the AAA solution based on customer requirement.
•	Redundancy test of the platform at cluster, networking device, and physical level.
•	IOT tests of AAA and provisioning service (SOAP).
•	Validate with L2 and L3 support complex technical requirements.
•	Technical advisor at any stage of the project.  
•	Point of contact during MOP implementations in test and Production environment.
•	Point of contact during project delivery.
•	Provide weekly report of the progress of the project to project management team and customer.
profile_positions.title: IT Infrastructure Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Cisco Networking Academy Program is a system of e-learning which provides students Internet technology essential skills for a global economy allowing Web-based content, online assessment tracking. As CCNA R&S Technical Instructor for the main responsibilities were:
•	Prepare and set up classes for a successful delivery.
•	Encourage students to achieve Cisco Certifications.
•	Support the diverse needs of the classroom, providing examples and different explanation methods in order to mitigate the doubts about protocols and technologies provided by Cisco for Routing & Switching at Associated level.
•	Conduct training engagements in the highest-quality and professional manner.
•	Maintain a current understanding of Cisco’s product offerings.
•	Monitoring student performance.
•	Conducting Hands on labs.
•	Promoting students to walk the extra mile using the following methods:  
        	Preparing advance labs for the most important topics of each course.
        	Interactive dynamics in class, open discussions to strengthen knowledge during each class.
        	Demanding a final project at the end of each course for validate integrally the knowledge provided during the course.
        	Requiring implementation of extra curriculum topics during final project and practical exam.
profile_positions.title: CCNA Routing and Switching Technical Instructor.

profile_positions.description:
As Packet Core Engineer for Systems VP, I was part of the team in charge of operate, maintain, monitor As Packet Core Engineer for Systems VP, I was part of the team in charge of operate, maintain, monitor and implement new requirement over the Ericsson Evolved Packet Core and core network Cisco elements of the 3rd Operator in Venezuela.
As Packet Core Engineer the main responsibilities were:
•	Warranty the availability of the Data Services for 2G/3G and LTE end users.
•	Provide onsite support for any outage under the EPC until its resolution, as well as provide root cause analysis after the problem was solved. 
•	Traffic migration between primary EPC site and secondary EPC site using DNS resolution method.
•	Onsite support for EPC software upgrade.
•	Troubleshoot Packet Core and EPC Interfaces Gn/Gp, S5/S8, Gi, SGi, Gy, Gz, Gx, S1-U, S1-MME, and AAA Interfaces.
•	Internal DNS configuration for LAC/RAC/TAC requirement for new access sites. 
•	Update Firewall and routing configuration according to the latest IR.21 and latest Roaming agreements of the company.
•	Create, update and modify private APNs with different IP addressing schemes and secure data solution (IPsec/GRE) according with customer requirements.
profile_positions.title: Packet Core Engineer
